sources.description: A database of bioactive drug-like small molecules and bioactivities abstracted from the scientific literature.
sources.name: chembl
sources.srcDetails: Standard InChIs and Keys provided on ftp site for each release.

sources.description: A database that combines drug (i.e. chemical, pharmacological and pharmaceutical) data with drug target (i.e. sequence, structure, and pathway) information.
sources.name: drugbank
sources.srcDetails: Standard InChIs and Keys provided within sd file on ftp site for each release.

sources.description: The European resource for the collection, organisation and dissemination of data on biological macromolecular structures, including structures of small molecule ligands for proteins.
sources.name: pdb
sources.srcDetails: Standard InChIs and Keys provided by direct querying of Oracle DB.

sources.description: The IUPHAR (International Union of Basic and Clinical Pharmacology)/BPS (British Pharmacological Society) Guide to PHARMACOLOGY database contains structures of small molecule ligands, peptides and antibodies, with their affinities at protein targets.
sources.name: gtopdb
sources.srcDetails: Standard InChIs and Keys available for download at http://www.guidetopharmacology.org/download.jsp

sources.description: A subset of the PubChem DB: from the original depositor 'drugs of the future' (Prous).
sources.name: pubchem_dotf
sources.srcDetails: Mol files for SIDs downloaded manually, via PubChem interface, and Standard InChIs and Keys generated by InChI software. SIDs used as identifiers.
sources.updateComments: Considered a static deposition into pubchem

sources.description: KEGG LIGAND is a composite DB consisting of COMPOUND, GLYCAN, REACTION, RPAIR, RCLASS, and ENZYME DBs, whose entries are identified by C, G, R, RP, RC, and EC numbers, respectively.
sources.name: kegg_ligand
sources.nameLong: KEGG (Kyoto Encyclopedia of Genes and Genomes) Ligand
sources.srcDetails: Mol files were downloaded manually prior to this download becoming private. Standard InChIs and Keys generated by InChI software.

sources.description: ChEBI is a freely available dictionary of molecular entities focused on 'small' chemical compounds
sources.name: chebi
sources.srcDetails: Std InChis (but no keys) provided on ftp site. Keys generated by UniChem. 'all star' compounds downloaded

sources.description: Collections of plated arrays of small molecules that have a history of use in human clinical trials. Assembled by the National Institutes of Health (NIH) through the Molecular Libraries Roadmap Initiative
sources.name: nih_ncc
sources.srcDetails: Mol files downloaded manually and Standard InChIs and Keys generated by InChI software

sources.description: A free database of commercially-available compounds for virtual screening, provided by the Shoichet Laboratory in the Department of Pharmaceutical Chemistry at the University of California, San Francisco (UCSF).  [Irwin and Shoichet, J. Chem. Inf. Model. 2005;45(1):177-82]
sources.name: zinc
sources.srcDetails: novirtual subset of ZINC15, as a file containing inchis and keys from http://files.docking.org/export/unichem/

sources.description: A free chemical structure search engine containing millions of public domain structures. Pricing, availabilities, and vendor information requires an eMolecules Plus subscription.
sources.name: emolecules
sources.srcDetails: Downloaded as an SD file from source, Converted to InChI and INChIKeys by UniChem

sources.description: The Gene Expression Atlas is a semantically enriched database of meta-analysis based summary statistics over a curated subset of ArrayExpress Archive, servicing queries for condition-specific gene expression patterns as well as broader exploratory searches for biologically interesting genes/samples.
sources.name: atlas
sources.srcDetails: Currently extracted from compound names.

sources.description: The primary goal of the FDA/USP Substance Registration System (SRS) is to unambiguously define all substances present in regulated products. Once a substance has been defined, the SRS assigns a strong identifier that is permanently associated with the substance: a UNII (Unique Ingredient Identifier). This is a a non-proprietary, free, unique, unambiguous, nonsemantic, alphanumeric identifier based on a substances molecular structure and/or descriptive information.
sources.name: fdasrs
sources.srcDetails: Download of InChIKeys in file UNII Data  from http://fdasis.nlm.nih.gov/srs/jsp/srs/uniiListDownload.jsp

sources.description: SureChEMBL automatically extracts chemistry from the full text of all major patent authorities. Compounds are derived from either chemical names found in text or in chemical depictions. All SureChEMBL compounds are included, except those failing UniChem loading rules.
sources.name: surechembl
sources.srcDetails: Standard InChIs and InChIKeys provided by a direct feed from the SureChEMBL database

sources.description: PharmGKB (Pharmacogenomics Knowledgebase) is a comprehensive resource that curates knowledge about the impact of genetic variation on drug response for clinicians and researchers.
sources.name: pharmgkb
sources.srcDetails: drugs.zip file from from download site https://www.pharmgkb.org/downloads/. Smiles contained in this file Converted to Std InChIs internally

sources.description: The Human Metabolome Database (HMDB) is a freely available electronic database containing detailed information about small molecule metabolites found in the human body. It is intended to be used for applications in metabolomics, clinical chemistry, biomarker discovery and general education. The database is designed to contain or link three kinds of data: 1) chemical data, 2) clinical data, and 3) molecular biology/biochemistry data
sources.name: hmdb
sources.srcDetails: SD file download from source, converted to InChIs within UniChem

sources.description: Selleck Chemicals is a supplier of biochemical products, including over 1,000 inhibitor products
sources.name: selleck
sources.srcDetails: SD file provided by email. InChIs generated by UniChem
sources.updateComments: Need to evaluate - currently default static set

sources.description: A subset of the PubChem DB: from the original depositor 'Thomson Pharma'.
sources.name: pubchem_tpharma
sources.srcDetails: Mol files for SIDs downloaded manually, via PubChem interface, and Standard InChIs and Keys generated by InChI software. SIDs used as identifiers.
sources.updateComments: Considered a static deposition into pubchem

sources.description: A database of normalized PubChem compounds (CIDs) from the PubChem Database.
sources.name: pubchem
sources.srcDetails: Standard InChIs and Keys provided on ftp site.

sources.description: An online drug discovery platform with virtual screening and molecular modelling services.
sources.name: mcule
sources.srcDetails: Standard InChIs and Keys provided by email.

sources.description: An NMR database (web database) for organic structures and their nuclear magnetic resonance (nmr) spectra. It allows for spectrum prediction (13C, 1H and other nuclei) as well as for searching spectra, structures and other properties. Last not least, it features peer-reviewed submission of datasets by its users.
sources.name: nmrshiftdb2
sources.srcDetails: Standard InChI and Keys available for download at http://nmrshiftdb.nmr.uni-koeln.de/nmrshiftdb2unichem.txt

sources.description: The LINCS DCIC facilitates and standardized the information relevant to LINCS assays as described in http://www.lincsproject.org/data/data-standards/
sources.name: lincs
sources.nameLong: Library of Integrated Network-based Cellular Signatures
sources.srcDetails: Standard InChIs and Keys downloadable fromhttp://lincs-dcic.org/metadata/SmallMolecules

sources.description: ACToR (Aggregated Computational Toxicology Resource)
sources.name: actor
sources.srcDetails: Standard InChIs and Keys generated from SMILES from DB download

sources.description: A biochemical knowledge-base on human metabolism
sources.name: recon
sources.srcDetails: Standard InChIs and Keys provided by email

sources.description: MolPort. A database designed to assist users find commercial sources of compounds. Access requires (free) registration. Only stock compounds included from Nov 2017.
sources.name: molport
sources.srcDetails: Standard InChIs and Keys provided on from MolPort ftp site, access on request.

sources.description: Nakkaji (The Japan Chemical Substance Dictionary) is an organic compound dictionary database prepared by the Japan Science and Technology Agency (JST).
sources.name: nikkaji
sources.srcDetails: Standard InChIs and Keys available from ftp site

sources.description: A public, web-accessible database of measured binding affinities, focusing chiefly on the interactions of proteins considered to be drug-targets with small, drug-like molecules
sources.name: bindingdb
sources.srcDetails: Standard InChIs and Keys available within a tsv file from download page.

sources.description: The foundation of chemical safety testing relies on chemistry information such as high-quality chemical structures and physicochemical properties. This information is used by scientists to predict the potential health risks of chemicals.The CompTox Dashboard is part of a suite of dashboards developed by EPA to help evaluate the safety of chemicals. It provides access to a variety of data and information on over 700,000 chemicals currently in use and of interest to environmental researchers. Within the CompTox Dashboard, users can access chemical structures, experimental and predicted physicochemical and toxicity data, and additional links to relevant websites and applications. It maps curated physicochemical property data associated with chemical substances to their corresponding chemical structures
sources.name: comptox
sources.srcDetails: Standard InChIs and Keys obtained from download page

sources.description: LIPID Metabolites And Pathways Strategy (LIPID MAPS) is a multi-institutional effort created to identify and quantitate, using a systems biology approach and sophisticated mass spectrometers, all of the major, and many minor, lipid species in mammalian cells, as well as to quantitate the changes in these species in response to perturbation
sources.name: lipidmaps
sources.srcDetails: Standard InChIs and Keys obtained from download page

sources.description: DrugCentral is an online drug information resource created and maintained by Division of Translational Informatics at University of New Mexico, providing information on active ingredients chemical entities, pharmaceutical products, drug mode of action, indications, pharmacologic action
sources.name: drugcentral
sources.srcDetails: Standard InChIs and Keys available as a download.

sources.description: A Database of information on naturally occurring carotenoids from many organisms, extracted  from the literature.
sources.name: carotenoiddb
sources.srcDetails: Standard InChIs and Keys available as a download

sources.description: A database for Metabolomics experiments and derived information. The database is cross-species, cross-technique and covers metabolite structures and their reference spectra as well as their biological roles, locations and concentrations, and experimental data from metabolic experiments.
sources.name: metabolights
sources.srcDetails: Standard InChIs and Keys available from FTP site

sources.description: A comprehensive Enzyme Information system containing enzyme functional data extracted directly from the primary literature.
sources.name: brenda
sources.srcDetails: Standard InChIKeys available as a download

sources.description: An expert curated resource of biochemical reactions designed for the annotation of enzymes and genome-scale metabolic networks and models
sources.name: rhea
sources.srcDetails: src_compound_ids  extracted from ChEBI download file.

sources.description: An online knowledge-base of chemicals and a platform of the Chinese domestic vendors in chemical industry
sources.name: chemicalbook
sources.srcDetails: Standard InChIs and Keys provided by email.

sources.description: SwissLipids is an expert curated resource that provides a framework for the integration of lipid and lipidomic data with biological knowledge and models
sources.name: swisslipids
sources.srcDetails: Download from https://www.swisslipids.org/api/index.php/downloadData

sources.description: A database of marketed drugs in the USA, containing label and package insert information
sources.name: dailymed
sources.srcDetails: Standard InChIs and Keys generated from preferred term lookup in ChEMBL

sources.description: Intervention names from ClinicalTrials.gov. A database of privately and publicly funded clinical studies conducted around the world
sources.name: clinicaltrials
sources.srcDetails: Manually downloaded and processed

sources.description: RxNorm provides normalized names for clinical drugs and links its names to many of the drug vocabularies commonly used in pharmacy management and drug interaction software
sources.name: rxnorm
sources.srcDetails: RxNorm Numerical ID

sources.description: MedChemExpress is a chemical supplier that provides 15,000+ selective Inhibitors and Agonists.
sources.name: MedChemExpress
sources.srcDetails: Standard InChIs and Keys provided by email
sources.updateComments: Will be moved to a download once they work out how

sources.description: Data from the Probes and Drugs group at probes-drugs.org
sources.name: probes_and_drugs
sources.srcDetails: Inchis, keys and SMILES as Aux

sources.description: CSD structures from the Cambridge Crystallographic Data Centre
sources.name: CCDC
sources.srcDetails: CCDC-supplied input file. CSD structures that are just the single chemical moiety and to co-crystals that contain this (hydrates, solvates, others). For clarity, the composite InChI for co-crystal will not be found in UniChem but the individual components will, excluding common solvates and ions.
